re

.

w

Mons
r
Charon
hathe presented unto her
Ma
tie
the forme of a Placcart intended to be published by the estates
of the United Provinces w
ch
he hathe shewed to her Ma
tie
not as a
thinge fullie resolved but conceaved by them to answere the demaund
made by her Ma
tie
for the Restraint of the transportac
o
n of victuell
into

and the west
tes: And because her Ma
tie
dothe
finde the Im
fection of the said Placart not satysfyinge her
expectac
o
n and that w
ch
they in all regard of Reason ought to
have
formed in the prohibic
o
n of victuell
and graine to be transported
to Spaigne and the west
tes: Her Highnes hathe thought good
to note the same by this declarac
o
n w
ch
yo
w

w
th
all to impart unto them, wherein yo
w

Reasons w
ch
her Ma
tie
dothe urge to move them to consult better of
this matter, w
ch
her pleasure ys yo
u
shall maintaine, and fortyfie
w
th
suche argument as yo
u

purpose. Moreover, whereas divers thinges have ben propounded
unto them
both
by yo
u
and M
r
Wilkes at his last beinge there, where
unto (as yet, they have given no full answere nor satysfacc

n,
Yo

tie

theire Resolution./
